intro: Leichhardtia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or forest margins. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
